title.narrative: 1.2 EARLY LEARNING AND INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: National education system strengthened to ensure inclusive access and high quality of pre-school and basic education for all children especially the most vulnerable children including children with disabilities and girls, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable, are benefiting from equitable access to high-impact interventions on health, nutrition, early childhood development, inclusive and quality pre-school and basic education, and integrated social protection from any forms of neglect, exploitation and violence from conception to basic education age

participating-org.narrative: THE INSTITUTE OF EDUCATION OF THE REPUBLIC OF AZERBAIJAN

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 0310/A0/06/881 1. INVESTING IN THE VERY BEST START TO EVERY CHILD S LIFE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National education system strengthened to ensure inclusive access and high quality of pre-school and basic education for allchildren especially the most vulnerable children including children with disabilities and girls

description.narrative: Access to quality inclusive preschool and school education for vulnerable children enhanced through expanding community-based preschool education services and inclusive education in regular schools of the country beyond Baku. Comprehensive evidence generated on the impact of the COVID-19 and the conflict escalation on education and schools informed adequate understanding and response by the national partners to address the most pressing needs, including mental health and learning losses among schoolchildren. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2022
